section.title: Install and configure the storage nodes for openSUSE and SUSE Linux Enterprise
section.para: This section describes how to install and configure storage nodes that operate the account, container, and object services. For simplicity, this configuration references two storage nodes, each containing two empty local block storage devices. The instructions use /dev/sdb and /dev/sdc, but you can substitute different values for your particular nodes.

Although Object Storage supports any file system with extended attributes (xattr), testing and benchmarking indicate the best performance and reliability on XFS. For more information on horizontally scaling your environment, see the Deployment Guide.
This section applies to openSUSE Leap 42.2 and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12 SP2.

[account] max connections = 2 path = /srv/node/ read only = False lock file = /var/lock/account.lock

[object] max connections = 2 path = /srv/node/ read only = False lock file = /var/lock/object.lock
step.para: Replace MANAGEMENT_INTERFACE_IP_ADDRESS with the IP address of the management network on the storage node.

note.para: The rsync service requires no authentication, so consider running it on a private network in production environments.

step.para: Start the rsyncd service and configure it to start when the system boots:
step.screen: # systemctl enable rsyncd.service # systemctl start rsyncd.service
